Dr. Miles delivered his last lecture on Shakespeare for this term
this past Thursday in Remsen
, Hall. The lecture, as eloquent
and interesting as the preceding
ones, continued the study of the
Shakespeareen tragedies.
In answer to a query as to the
reason for the dominance of the
tragedies over the comedies in
former literature, Dr. Miles suggested two causes. The tragedy
strikes a more stirring note as it
is more likely than comedy to occur in actual life. Also, one is
more apt to exhibit the most ht.
teresting parts of his characters
when he is under the stress of
trouble and sadness than he is
when in a light and carefree moment. Dr. Miles blames the
movies as being the greatest
cause for 'the modern dislike for
unhappy endings. Often the real
plot and theme of the story is
ruined by the imagined necessity
for having the audience return
home cheerful and lighthearted.

TUDOR AND STUART CLUB
ANNUAL LECTURE GIVEN

Contrast With Moderns

The tragedies of Shakespeare
were contrasted to those of modern authors, as exemplified by Mr.
Dreiser's ."American Tragedy",
in that the former leave us inspired and exhilarated. while th
latter leaves us depressed.
Shakespeare has written fiat
great tragedies: Othello, Macbeth, King Lear and Hamlet. In
them he has involved threeitypes
of tragedy: death, old age, ,and
madness. The most striking an
impressing are the last two. Both
of them appear in King Lear
which is considered by many te
be the greatest of Shakespeare's
tragedies. In Hamlet we have th
madness of Ophelia and the death
of almost, all the principal characters, but in Othello and Macbeth
we have only death.

Dr. Miles delivered his last lecture on Shakespeare for this term
this past Thursday in Remsen
, Hall. The lecture, as eloquent
and interesting as the preceding
ones, continued the study of the
Shakespeareen tragedies.
In answer to a query as to the
reason for the dominance of the
tragedies over the comedies in
former literature, Dr. Miles suggested two causes. The tragedy
strikes a more stirring note as it
is more likely than comedy to occur in actual life. Also, one is
more apt to exhibit the most ht.
teresting parts of his characters
when he is under the stress of
trouble and sadness than he is
when in a light and carefree moment. Dr. Miles blames the
movies as being the greatest
cause for 'the modern dislike for
unhappy endings. Often the real
plot and theme of the story is
ruined by the imagined necessity
for having the audience return
home cheerful and lighthearted.

TUDOR AND STUART CLUB
ANNUAL LECTURE GIVEN

Contrast With Moderns

The tragedies of Shakespeare
were contrasted to those of modern authors, as exemplified by Mr.
Dreiser's ."American Tragedy",
in that the former leave us inspired and exhilarated. while th
latter leaves us depressed.
Shakespeare has written fiat
great tragedies: Othello, Macbeth, King Lear and Hamlet. In
them he has involved threeitypes
of tragedy: death, old age, ,and
madness. The most striking an
impressing are the last two. Both
of them appear in King Lear
which is considered by many te
be the greatest of Shakespeare's
tragedies. In Hamlet we have th
madness of Ophelia and the death
of almost, all the principal characters, but in Othello and Macbeth
we have only death.
